articles.title: Andy Murray joins Roger Federer in backing ATP and WTA merger
articles.description: Andy Murray is backing a merger between the men's and women's tennis tours, a topic that rose to the forefront after a tweet from Roger Federer during the sport's lockdown due to the coronavirus.

articles.author: Kate Sullivan, MJ Lee and Eric Bradner, CNN
articles.title: What we know about Tara Reade's allegation against Joe Biden
articles.description: Former Vice President Joe Biden on Friday denied a former aide's claim that he sexually assaulted her 27 years ago, saying in his first public statement on the matter that the alleged incident "never happened."

articles.title: Houston police helicopter crashes. 1 pilot dies, another in critical condition
articles.description: A Houston Police Department helicopter crashed early Saturday morning, killing one pilot and leaving the other in critical condition, authorities said.

articles.author: Jen Rose Smith, CNN
articles.title: Banana bread is having a moment
articles.description: If there's an unofficial snack of the coronavirus pandemic, it's a sweet, soft loaf of home-baked banana bread. Celebrities like Chrissy Teigen love it, and ttreat has been the most searched-for recipe across all US states for the last 30 days.

articles.description: Owners of more than 120 of Georgia's most popular restaurants announced this week they won't be reopening their doors just yet, despite getting a green light to do so from the governor.

articles.author: Ashley Strickland, CNN
articles.title: Eta Aquariid meteor shower: When and how to watch
articles.description: The Eta Aquariid meteor shower is expected to peak on Tuesday, but a nearly full moon could outshine the show. They may be most visible on Sunday morning before dawn on Sunday, with a better chance for more visible meteors in the southern hemisphere.

articles.author: Allen Kim, CNN
articles.title: The Boy Scouts of America are inviting families across the US to participate in a virtual camp-in
articles.description: The Boy Scouts of America are inviting kids across America to participate in a virtual camp-in. The National camp-in begins on May 2 at 11 a.m. E.T., and it is open for anyone to participate.

articles.description: The first wave of emergency medical technicians who contracted Covid-19 and survived are now returning to the job, armed with a first-hand understanding of the disease and a new empathy for the patients.

articles.author: Allen Kim, CNN
articles.title: NBC will be hosting a virtual Kentucky Derby featuring Triple Crown winners
articles.description: With the 146th Kentucky Derby being postponed until September 5, horse racing fans are being treated to a virtual horse race featuring the past 13 Triple Crown winners. NBC will also broadcast the 2015 Kentucky Derby on May 2 starting at 3 p.m. E.T.

articles.title: Tara Reade's allegation against Joe Biden deserves full scrutiny
articles.description: Alice Stewart writes, "Right or wrong, guilty or innocent, elected officials are often flawed vessels elected to deliver a desired political outcome. But if a candidate promises to 'restore' my soul, more transparency doesn't seem too much to ask for."
